FormattedTextArea - XHTML markup tests (h1)

Introduction to the FormattedTextArea widget (h2)

The FormattedTextArea widget displays markup formatted text. Currently supported is a sub-set of XHTML, that includes the HTML block elements <header>header</header>, <body>body</body>, <p>paragraph</p>, <div>division</div>, <span>span</span>, <h1>headline 1</h1> ... <h6>headline 6</h6>, <em>emphasized</em>, <strong>strong</strong>, <i>italic</i>, <b>bold</b>, <u>underline</u>, <sup>superscript</sup> for superscript text, <sub>subscript</sub> for subscript text, the XHTML empty elements <br/> for line break and <image/> for images like (100%) and XHTML inner text of any block. In addition to that, all block elements support the style attribute (currently the color style only) and the images can be zoomed like this (67%) or this (133%).

Various text tests (h2)

Floating text and block text tests (h3)

Change the witdth of the window to test automatic line break functionality. (h4)

This is the first floating text line (not embedded in a <span>span</span>, <div>division</div> or <p>paragraph</p>). It is followed by a line break.
This is the second floating text line (not embedded in a <span>span</span>, <div>division</div> or <p>paragraph</p>).
This is the first block text (embedded in a <div>division</div>). It shall demonstrate no vertical spacing around this block and automatic line breaks.

This is the second block text (embedded in a <p>paragraph</p>). It shall demonstrate vertical spacing around this block and a floating text and besides automatic line breaks.

While the images so far have been set from a base64 memory stream, this image is loaded from a PNG file (which might not work in browsers):

This is the final floating text line with a <span>span</span> (inline-style = color:green).

List tests (h3)

Nested list tests (h4)

Example of unordered lists:
  • First unordered list item
  • Second unordered list item
    • Coffee
    • Tea
  • Third unordered list item
Example of ordered lists:
  1. First ordered list item
  2. Second ordered list item
    1. Apple
    2. Orange
  3. Third ordered list item

Code and style-sheet tests (h3)

Code with style sheet test (h4)

#include <TGUI/TGUI.hpp>
#include <TGUI/Backend/SFML-Graphics.hpp>

int main()
{
    sf::RenderWindow window{{800, 600}, "TGUI example - SFML_GRAPHICS backend"};
    tgui::Gui gui{window};
    gui.mainLoop(); // See below for how to use your own main loop
}
